t: Mark 14
The Plot to Kill Jesus
After*p two days it was the Passover and the*i Feast*i of Unleavened Bread. And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take Him by trickery and put Him*i to death.
But they said, “Not during the feast, lest there be an uproar of the people.”
The Anointing at Bethany

And*p being in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper, as He sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster flask of very costly oil of spikenard. Then she broke the flask and poured it*i on His head.
But there were some who were indignant among themselves, and said, “Why was this fragrant oil wasted?
For it might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor.” And they criticized her sharply.
But*p Jesus said, “Let*r her*r alone.*r Why*r do*r you*r trouble*r her?*r She*r has*r done*r a*r good*r work*r for*r Me.*r
For*r you*r have*r the*r poor*r with*r you*r always,*r and*r whenever*r you*r wish*r you*r may*r do*r them*r good;*r but*r Me*r you*r do*r not*r have*r always.*r
She*r has*r done*r what*r she*r could.*r She*r has*r come*r beforehand*r to*r anoint*r My*r body*r for*r burial.*r
Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r wherever*r this*r gospel*r is*r preached*r in*r the*r whole*r world,*r what*r this*r woman*r has*r done*r will*r also*r be*r told*r as*r a*r memorial*r to*r her.”*r
Judas Agrees to Betray Jesus
Then*p Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Him to them.
And when they heard it,*i they were glad, and promised to give him money. So he sought how he might conveniently betray Him.
Jesus Celebrates the Passover with His Disciples
Now*p on the first day of Unleavened Bread, when they killed the Passover lamb,*i His disciples said to Him, “Where do You want us to go and prepare, that You may eat the Passover?”
And*p He sent out two of His disciples and said to them, “Go*r into*r the*r city,*r and*r a*r man*r will*r meet*r you*r carrying*r a*r pitcher*r of*r water;*r follow*r him.*r

Wherever*r he*r goes*r in,*r say*r to*r the*r master*r of*r the*r house,*r ‘The*r Teacher*r says,*r “Where*r is*r the*r guest*r room*r in*r which*r I*r may*r eat*r the*r Passover*r with*r My*r disciples?”’*r
Then*r he*r will*r show*r you*r a*r large*r upper*r room,*r furnished*r and*ir prepared;*r there*r make*r ready*r for*r us.”*r
So*p His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found it just as He had said to them; and they prepared the Passover.
In*p the evening He came with the twelve.
Now as they sat and ate, Jesus said, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r one*r of*r you*r who*r eats*r with*r Me*r will*r betray*r Me.”*r
And*p they began to be sorrowful, and to say to Him one by one, “Is*i it I?” And another said,*i “Is*i it I?”
He*p answered and said to them, “It*ir is*ir one*r of*r the*r twelve,*r who*r dips*r with*r Me*r in*r the*r dish.*r

The*r Son*r of*r Man*r indeed*r goes*r just*r as*r it*r is*r written*r of*r Him,*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r betrayed!*r It*r would*r have*r been*r good*r for*r that*r man*r if*r he*r had*r never*r been*r born.”*r
Jesus Institutes the Lord’s Supper
And*p as they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it,*i and gave it*i to them and said, “Take,*r eat;*r this*r is*r My*r body.”*r
Then*p He took the cup, and when He had given thanks He gave it*i to them, and they all drank from it.
And He said to them, “This*r is*r My*r blood*r of*r the*r new*r covenant,*r which*r is*r shed*r for*r many.*r
Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r will*r no*r longer*r drink*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine*r until*r that*r day*r when*r I*r drink*r it*r new*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
And*p when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Jesus Predicts Peter’s Denial

Then*p Jesus said to them, “All*r of*r you*r will*r be*r made*r to*r stumble*r because*r of*r Me*r this*r night,*r for*r it*r is*r written:*r ‘I*rpn will*r strike*r the*r Shepherd,*r And*rld the*r sheep*r will*r be*r scattered.’*r
“But*rp after*r I*r have*r been*r raised,*r I*r will*r go*r before*r you*r to*r Galilee.”*r
Peter*p said to Him, “Even if all are made to stumble, yet I will*i not be.”*i
Jesus*p said to him, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r today,*r even*ir this*r night,*r before*r the*r rooster*r crows*r twice,*r you*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r
But*p he spoke more vehemently, “If I have to die with You, I will not deny You!” And*p they all said likewise.
The Prayer in the Garden
Then*p they came to a place which was named Gethsemane; and He said to His disciples, “Sit*r here*r while*r I*r pray.”*r
And He took Peter, James, and John with Him, and He began to be troubled and deeply distressed.
Then He said to them, “My*r soul*r is*r exceedingly*r sorrowful,*r even*ir to*r death.*r Stay*r here*r and*r watch.”*r
He*p went a little farther, and fell on the ground, and prayed that if it were possible, the hour might pass from Him.
And He said, “Abba,*r Father,*r all*r things*r are*ir possible*r for*r You.*r Take*r this*r cup*r away*r from*r Me;*r nevertheless,*r not*r what*r I*r will,*r but*r what*r You*r will.”*ir
Then*p He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon,*r are*r you*r sleeping?*r Could*r you*r not*r watch*r one*r hour?*r
Watch*r and*r pray,*r lest*r you*r enter*r into*r temptation.*r The*r spirit*r indeed*r is*ir willing,*r but*r the*r flesh*r is*ir weak.”*r
Again*p He went away and prayed, and spoke the same words.
And when He returned, He found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy; and they did not know what to answer Him.

Then*p He came the third time and said to them, “Are*r you*r still*r sleeping*r and*r resting?*r It*r is*r enough!*r The*r hour*r has*r come;*r behold,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r being*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinners.*r
Rise,*r let*r us*r be*r going.*r See,*r My*r betrayer*r is*r at*r hand.”*r
Betrayal and Arrest in Gethsemane
And*p immediately, while He was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, with a great multitude with swords and clubs, came from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
Now His betrayer had given them a signal, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the One; seize Him and lead Him*i away safely.”
As*p soon as he had come, immediately he went up to Him and said to Him, “Rabbi, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
Then*p they laid their hands on Him and took Him.
And one of those who stood by drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
Then*p Jesus answered and said to them, “Have*r you*r come*r out,*r as*r against*r a*r robber,*r with*r swords*r and*r clubs*r to*r take*r Me?*r
I*r was*r daily*r with*r you*r in*r the*r temple*r teaching,*r and*r you*r did*r not*r seize*r Me.*r But*r the*r Scriptures*r must*r be*r fulfilled.”*r
Then*p they all forsook Him and fled.
A Young Man Flees Naked
Now*p a certain young man followed Him, having a linen cloth thrown around his*i naked body.*i And the young men laid hold of him,
and he left the linen cloth and fled from them naked.
Jesus Faces the Sanhedrin
And*p they led Jesus away to the high priest; and with him were assembled all the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes.
But Peter followed Him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest. And he sat with the servants and warmed himself at the fire.
Now*p the chief priests and all the council sought testimony against Jesus to put Him to death, but found none.
For many bore false witness against Him, but their testimonies did not agree.
Then*p some rose up and bore false witness against Him, saying,
“We heard Him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with hands, and within three days I will build another made without hands.’”
But not even then did their testimony agree.
And*p the high priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus, saying, “Do You answer nothing? What is*i it*i these men testify against You?”
But He kept silent and answered nothing. Again*p the high priest asked Him, saying to Him, “Are You the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?”
Jesus*p said, “I*r am.*r And*r you*r will*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r sitting*r at*r the*r right*r hand*r of*r the*r Power,*r and*r coming*r with*r the*r clouds*r of*r heaven.”*r
Then*p the high priest tore his clothes and said, “What further need do we have of witnesses?
You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?” And*p they all condemned Him to be deserving of death.
Then*p some began to spit on Him, and to blindfold Him, and to beat Him, and to say to Him, “Prophesy!” And the officers struck Him with the palms of their hands.
Peter Denies Jesus, and Weeps
Now*p as Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came.
And when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You also were with Jesus of Nazareth.”
But*p he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you are saying.” And he went out on the porch, and a rooster crowed.
And*p the servant girl saw him again, and began to say to those who stood by, “This is one*i of them.”
But he denied it again. And*p a little later those who stood by said to Peter again, “Surely you are one*i of them; for you are a Galilean, and your speech shows it.”*i
Then*p he began to curse and swear, “I do not know this Man of whom you speak!”

A*p second time the*i rooster crowed. Then Peter called to mind the word that Jesus had said to him, “Before*r the*r rooster*r crows*r twice,*r you*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r And when he thought about it, he wept.
